Re: License #: CB171001625
Dear Ms. Tremblay:
Attached is the Original Licensing Study Report for the above referenced facility. The
study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing statutes and
administrative rules. Therefore, an original license is issued.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Douglas W Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The agency is located in a two story, modern duplex home in Sault Ste Marie,
Michigan. The home was newly built within the last 5 years and has sufficient
beds, furniture and living resources. One duplex section of the home will be
utilized and provides 5 beds for independent living youth. The agency case worker
has an on-site office. Administrative offices are located approximately one mile
away from the facility. The administrative office contains locked cabinets where
staff and youth files are kept.
B. Program Description
The agency will provide independent living case management services to MDHHS
referred male youth. The agency provides referrals, information, life skills and
support for youth to assist in meeting their individual needs and goals. Youth in
the program receive academic counseling as well as assistance in enrolling in
vocational or educational programs. Agency staff assist youth in completing
educational program applications for admission as well as applying for
educational financial aid.
2

The program provides community integration and life skills training.
Youth will also receive career counseling and learn skills in seeking and
maintaining employment. Staff will assist youth in resume development.
Where and when appropriate, youth will receive counseling services to address
anxiety, trauma, depression and substance abuse. Youth will also be provided
resources for seeking and maintaining medical and dental services when needed.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
The agency is in compliance with all rules at statutes at this time.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on substantial compliance with the rules, it is recommended that a six-month
original license be issued.
October 24, 2024
